status.name: Closed

fields.summary: ELB access logs collection fails when logs prefix contains an uppercase letter

comments.body: Refer to the comments in GUI-2174 for investigation into this issue.

[~swathi]: Could we fix this in 4.2.1, since the related GUI tickets are slated to be fixed in 4.2.1?

/cc [~dcalzago], [~jloza]

[~sjones]: The issue in GUI-2174 may be caused by faulty IAM behavior. Can you please confirm if that's accurate? 

[~kgill]: If this is indeed an IAM issue, I'll let [~sjones] answer the question as to when it might get fixed. IAM effects authorization of every single request and I don't want to accidentally break anything in that path. However, if the issue is local to OSG (specific to OSG invocations of IAM checks) then it should be addressed in 4.2.1
Help topics affected by this bug are documented in DOC-1692 and this bug added to the KI list for 4.2.

[~sjones]: I debugged this a little more and found that the logic in PolicyEngineImpl.java converts/canonicalizes the resource being operated on to lower case but the IAM policy that its matched against remains as it is - else condition on [line 480|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/auth/policy/PolicyEngineImpl.java#L480] is executed with canonicalized resource name and unchanged IAM policy. This might be causing the regex match to fail when the IAM policy contains upper case letters - [line 486|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/master/clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/auth/policy/PolicyEngineImpl.java#L486] in matchOne() returns false
Fixing this issue would mean changing the way policy is evaluated in a backwards incompatible way. This fix should be deferred until 4.3.

[~sjones]: Are there any other places where the case-specific policy evaluation behavior could bite us?

/cc [~jloza]
[~kgill], the problem is that we are incorrectly treating S3 resource names as case insensitive in some places.
A temporary fix in 4.2.x can be for ELB service to not allow uppercase letters in the prefix.
This is fixed due to the changes in EUCA-11534.

Fix verified.
[root@d-37 spark]# eulb-describe-lb-attributes testlb
AccessLog.EmitInterval	5
AccessLog.Enabled	true
AccessLog.S3BucketName	WebServerLog
AccessLog.S3BucketPrefix	myPrefix
ConnectionDraining.Enabled	false
ConnectionSettings.IdleTimeout	60
CrossZoneLoadBalancing.Enabled	false


[root@d-37 spark]# s3cmd/s3cmd -c ./s3.cfg ls s3://WebServerLog/myPrefix/AWSLogs/000212470003/elasticloadbalancing/eucalyptus/2016/6/9/
2016-06-09 00:55     11413   s3://WebServerLog/myPrefix/AWSLogs/000212470003/elasticloadbalancing/eucalyptus/2016/6/9/000212470003_elasticloadbalancing_eucalyptus_testlb_20160609T0055Z_0.0.0.0_95ch80ao.log
